headline: 26GW Australian Renewable Energy Hub secures AU$21 million ARENA boost for Pilbara green hydrogen push
summary_80w: The 26GW Australian Renewable Energy Hub (AREH) in Western Australia has secured AU$21 million (US$14.71 million) in funding from the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) to advance large-scale hydrogen production capabilities that will support green iron manufacturing in the Pilbara region.

headline: Philippines House of Representatives passes national energy storage framework legislation
summary_80w: A framework for the “development, utilisation and commercialisation of energy storage systems” in the Philippines has been passed by the House of Representatives.

headline: 437MWh BESS in Australia’s highest city receives final approvals ahead of commissioning
summary_80w: Valent Energy has received development approval from the New South Wales government and satisfied AEMO grid compliance requirements under clause 5.3.4a for its 150MW/437MWh Armidale Battery Energy Storage System (BESS).

headline: Octopus Australia acquires 4.8GWh battery storage project in New South Wales
summary_80w: Octopus Australia has announced plans to develop what it claims is Australia's “largest planned battery energy storage system (BESS)” in New South Wales.

headline: Australia’s biggest LDES tender: NSW contracts six battery storage projects totalling 1.17GW/12GWh
summary_80w: ASL (formerly AEMO Services) has completed New South Wales' (NSW) largest-ever tender for long-duration energy storage (LDES), contracting six new battery projects for a combined 1.17GW/11.98GWh.

headline: Enphase to cut 160 jobs globally, as Q4 microinverter shipments drop to 682MW
summary_80w: Microinverter supplier Enphase Energy has filed an 8-K form with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) stating that it will reduce its workforce globally by nearly 160 jobs.

headline: Hybridise or die: Solar and storage valuations under pressure
summary_80w: Industry leaders warn that hybridising PV with batteries is now essential to secure revenue, manage volatility, and maintain investor value.

headline: Cost the key consideration in European supply chains as reliance on China remains
summary_80w: In the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, European energy has gone from an overreliance on Russia to an overreliance on China.

headline: ‘Different production profiles with one grid connection’: solutions to Europe’s grid capacity crunch
summary_80w: Optimising existing grid capacity could be the most viable solution to Europe’s long-standing grid capacity challenges.

headline: Avangrid commissions 269MW solar PV in Oregon
summary_80w: Avangrid, a subsidiary of Spanish utility Iberdrola, has reached commercial operations at two PV power plants in the US state of Oregon.

headline: Zelestra inks 176MW Texas solar PV PPA with Meta, 50MW in Ohio with AEPEP
summary_80w: Spanish renewable energy company Zelestra has finalised a power purchase agreement with Facebook’s parent company Meta for its 176MW Skull Creek Solar Plant in Texas.

headline: US defends IRA domestic content bonus after China scores WTO win
summary_80w: US authorities have hit back at a WTO ruling that subsidies for domestically produced solar and other clean energy components discriminate against Chinese firms.

headline: Changing risk profiles, portfolio-based decisions highlight shifts in renewables investment landscape
summary_80w: 'The market is evolving,' said Daniel Machuca on the topic of traditional financing models and their suitability for use in modern renewables.

headline: Australia: EnergyCo seeks federal approval for 6GW New England REZ transmission backbone spanning 315km
summary_80w: Energy Corporation of NSW (EnergyCo) has submitted an Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act (EPBC) referral for the New England Renewable Energy Zone (REZ) transmission infrastructure project in Australia.

headline: NEM Data Spotlight: Australia’s solar sector continues momentum with 222GWh peak daily output in January 2026
summary_80w: The latest edition in our NEM Data Spotlight series delves into solar PV data from January 2026 and how it hit a daily peak of 222GWh.

headline: Evecon, Mirova and Corsica Sole inaugurate first of two 100MW/200MWh BESS in Estonia
summary_80w: A 100MW/200MWh BESS project in Estonia has been inaugurated by Baltic Storage Platform (BSP), a joint venture (JV) between Baltic developer Evecon, French independent power producer (IPP) Corsica Sole and investment manager Mirova.

headline: Energy storage players Great Power, Sunwoda and Deye Technology file Hong Kong listing applications
summary_80w: Three Chinese energy storage companies have recently successively filed or updated their listing applications with the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (HKEX), planning IPOs on the Hong Kong Main Board.

headline: Standalone solar no longer enough in Europe as storage takes centre stage
summary_80w: “Standalone solar is not dead, but it is challenging,” said Pierre Bartholin, head of power hedging at investor Nuveen Infrastructure, opening the debate at Solar Media’s Solar Finance Investment Europe (SFIE) conference in London on the future of co-located battery storage.

headline: Enlight advances US$3 billion, 1.2GW solar 4GWh BESS ‘Complex’ in Arizona
summary_80w: IPP Enlight Renewable Energy has reached development milestones for its total 1.21GW solar plus 4GWh energy storage CO Bar Complex in Arizona, US, and is now advancing the project toward operation.

headline: LG Energy Solution targets 90GWh of battery orders in US energy storage market in 2026
summary_80w: LG Energy Solution will keep global battery cell production at around 300GWh in 2026, while increasing its proportion of supply for energy storage system (ESS) applications.

headline: Why the best way to avoid BESS commissioning delays is to start earlier than you might expect
summary_80w: Commissioning is often an underestimated final step in the hard work it takes to bring a BESS project online, writes Lynn Appollis-Laurent of Camelot Energy.

headline: How US states are stepping up to fill the renewable energy policy void
summary_80w: PV Talk: Vote Solar’s Sachu Constantine discusses the growing role of state and local governments in driving forward clean energy policy in the United States.

headline: Tonic Group secures fast-track federal approval for 75MW Western Australia solar-battery project
summary_80w: Tonic Group has obtained federal environmental clearance for a 75MW solar-plus-storage development in Western Australia within four weeks.

headline: Philippines-China tension could endanger solar PV supply, says trade association
summary_80w: The Philippines’ solar and energy storage trade body has warned that diplomatic tensions with China could disrupt the solar industry.

headline: US and India strike trade deal, cutting tariffs to 18% in ‘strategic turning point’ for Indian PV manufacturers
summary_80w: The US and India have announced a trade deal under which Washington will cut reciprocal tariffs on Indian goods to 18% from 25%.

headline: ‘Difficult’ to make EU solar procurement initiatives work ‘on the ground’, developers say
summary_80w: Resilience against supply chain risks in Europe comes in the form of early action, a panel at Solar Finance and Investment Europe agreed.

headline: Europe needs private capital to ‘step in’ to support grid expansions, industry players say
summary_80w: Integrating more private investment into Europe’s grid infrastructure will be a necessity if the continent's bottlenecks are to be overcome.

headline: ‘Clear cooling’ of equity investment in US renewables, creating opportunities for Europe
summary_80w: There has been a 'clear cooling' of appetite for new renewable energy investments in the US, according to speakers at SFIEU 2026.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Energy Montana energises 150MWh BESS
summary_80w: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway-owned BHE Renewables has successfully energised its 75MW/150MWh Glacier Battery System project in Montana, US.

headline: ‘Scrutinising origin, ownership, and control’: FEOC rules change US BESS buying
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium hears from Tom Cornell, CEO and President of Prevalon Energy, about the company's strategies for navigating upcoming changes in the energy storage industry over the next year.

headline: ‘Spain’s regulatory landscape still incomplete’: Nuveen on bankability in Southern Europe
summary_80w: While steps are being taken, Spain still lacks the market mechanisms and regulatory framework for large-scale energy storage.

headline: Uniper signs 5GWh conditional supply agreement for CMBlu’s organic flow batteries
summary_80w: Power firm Uniper has entered into a conditional supply contract with organic solid flow battery company CMBlu Energy for the delivery of at least 5GWh of its technology.

headline: As data centre capacity surges, merchant revenue battery storage play emerges as a consideration, financier says
summary_80w: Energy storage is expected to play a significant role in enabling the global data centre build-out, although the commercial and financing models developers will use are evolving, Energy-Storage.news has learned.

headline: Tonic Group bags rapid EPBC Act approval for 440MWh solar-plus-storage site in Western Australia
summary_80w: Tonic Group has received federal environmental approval for a 440MWh solar-plus-storage facility in Western Australia in less than a month.

headline: Western Australia’s ERA proposes AU$491,700/MW benchmark price driven by 1,200MWh battery storage specifications
summary_80w: Western Australia's ERA has proposed a Benchmark Reserve Capacity Price of AU$491,700/MW per year for the 2028-29 capacity year.

headline: Younan Company enters renewables with 880MW solar-plus-storage plant in California
summary_80w: Private equity firm Younan Company has launched an 880MW solar-plus-storage project in California, marking its entry into utility-scale solar PV in the US.

headline: Tesla energy storage deployments jumped in ‘crucial AI transformation year’; company expects margin compression in 2026
summary_80w: Tesla reported company-high energy storage deployments and revenue growth in 2025 but expects “low-cost competition” and policy factors to affect margins this year.

headline: TerraForm Power buys 1.56GW solar project in Illinois
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) TerraForm Power has acquired a 1.56GW solar project in Lee County, Illinois from Hexagon Energy.

headline: North American solar PPA prices climb to US$61.67/MWh, European prices continue to fall
summary_80w: The price of solar PPAs signed in North America increased 3.2% between the third and fourth quarters of 2025, reaching a high of US$61.67/MWh.

headline: New PV self-consumption installs in Spain drop to 1.1GW in 2025 – UNEF
summary_80w: The rate of installation of new self-consumption PV systems in Spain fell slightly last year, according to data from trade body the Spanish Photovoltaic Union (UNEF).

headline: India’s solar sector welcomes Budget measures to support local PV manufacturing
summary_80w: India’s Union Budget 2026-27 reinforces government support for renewables through duty exemptions and infrastructure spending.

headline: ‘A growing sense of threat’ underpins EU’s cybersecurity act revision
summary_80w: PV Tech Premium explores the impacts that the EU's revised cybersecurity review will have on the continent's solar industry.

headline: US Governors in PJM territory move to unlock renewable energy, energy storage investment
summary_80w: The Governors of Maryland and New Jersey have enacted legislation to accelerate the deployment of clean energy technologies in response to energy cost and supply concerns.

headline: BW ESS proposes 1.6GWh battery energy storage facility for the Hunter Valley in Australia
summary_80w: Energy storage owner-operator BW ESS has submitted an application under Australia's Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act for a 1,600MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) in New South Wales (NSW).

headline: Origin Energy begins generating revenue from two utility-scale battery storage sites in Australia

headline: India Power signs deal to build 70MWp solar project in Bhutan
summary_80w: India Power Corporation Limited has partnered with Bhutan’s Green Energy Power Private Limited to develop a 70MWp solar power plant in Paro, Bhutan

headline: Scatec posts US$350 million revenues in Q4
summary_80w: Scatec has reported strong fourth-quarter results with proportionate revenues increasing 25% year-on-year to NOK3,362 million (US$2.68 billion).

headline: Solarcycle begins PV panels recycling operations at Georgia facility
summary_80w: US-based PV recycling firm Solarcycle has begun operations at its Cedartown recycling facility in Georgia, US.

headline: Voltalia awarded 132MW solar PV project in Tunisia
summary_80w: A 132MW solar PV project from French renewables company Voltalia has been selected by the Tunisian government for construction.

headline: UNSW scientists demand enhanced UV testing protocols as TOPCon cells show unexpected vulnerability patterns
summary_80w: In an interview with PV Tech Premium, two UNSW researchers emphasise the need for enhanced UV testing for TOPCon solar cells.

headline: Jupiter Power closes US$500 million corporate credit facility to support US BESS projects

headline: Battery recycler Redwood receives financing boost from Google, aims to expand US energy storage division
summary_80w: Redwood Energy announced the final closing of its Series E financing round, bringing the total raise to US$425 million.

headline: At nearly 200GWh, China’s new energy storage deployment rate hit record high in 2025
summary_80w: By the end of December 2025, China’s cumulative installed capacity of new energy storage technologies including lithium-ion reached 144.7GW, representing an 85% year-on-year rise.

headline: Battery storage claims 46% share of Australia’s record 64GW energy investment pipeline
summary_80w: Battery energy storage projects have emerged as the dominant force in Australia's energy investment landscape, accounting for 46% of the nation's 64GW development pipeline, according to the Australian Energy Market Operator's (AEMO) latest quarterly report.

headline: Korean-led consortium begins construction at 350MW solar PV plant in Texas
summary_80w: A Korean-led consortium including Hyundai Engineering has started construction at a 350MW solar PV plant in Dallas, Texas.

headline: Renewables pricing in Europe and US set for major recalibration – Pexapark
summary_80w: Clean energy pricing in Europe and America is set for a decisive adjustment in 2026 as record deployment levels collide with heightened market volatility and policy headwinds.

headline: RWE starting construction on 400MW/800MWh Germany BESS
summary_80w: Power firm RWE is about to start building a 400MW/800MWh BESS project in Germany, among the largest in the country to reach the construction stage. In related news, Kyon Energy has connected a 282MWh project to the grid, possibly the largest in the country to reach that milestone.

headline: Westbridge Renewable receives approval to build 225MW/200MWh solar-plus-storage plant in Alberta
summary_80w: Canadian renewables firm Westbridge Renewable Energy has received approval from the Alberta Utilities Commission (AUC) to build an up to 225MW solar-plus-storage plant in Alberta, Canada.

headline: Enfinity Global starts commercial operations at 33.8MW Italian solar PV project, first of Microsoft PPA portfolio
summary_80w: Enfinity has started commercial operations at a 33.8MW solar PV project, the first in a portfolio from which Microsoft will acquire power

headline: Rising Chinese module prices will be ‘short-term’, says Rystad Energy
summary_80w: The cost of Chinese solar module manufacturing will rise in the first half of 2026, though prices may fall again before the end of the year.

headline: ‘Clear and concerning’ rise in PV module defects – Kiwa PI Berlin
summary_80w: PV module defects are increasing as manufacturers struggle to achieve consistent quality through robust bill-of-material and process controls.

headline: CLASS trade association launches, aims to expand access to community solar and battery storage in California
summary_80w: A new trade association, Californians for Local, Affordable Solar and Storage (CLASS) has started work to improve access to community solar.

headline: Europe renewables M&A in 2026: hotter markets, tougher filters—and the rise of platform-led execution
summary_80w: Renewables-specific M&A platforms offer project buyers and sellers transparency and efficiency in Europe’s increasingly selective deal environment, writes Ksenia Dray.

headline: Clean energy conquers coal as Australia’s NEM delivers historic 51% renewables quarter
summary_80w: The Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) has announced that renewable energy sources supplied more than half of the quarterly energy demand in the National Electricity Market (NEM) for the first time.

headline: Australian startup WinDC hopes to turn solar curtailment into AI gold with Megaport network deal
summary_80w: Australian data centre startup WinDC has announced a strategic partnership with Megaport that will connect its renewables-powered AI factories to Megaport's global Network-as-a-Service platform.

headline: How energy storage can help data centres reduce their grid impact
summary_80w: “We see energy storage as an opportunity for (data centres) to reduce their impact on the grid”, said Patrick Hughes, Senior VP of Operations and Strategy at NEMA.

headline: Hydrostor announces equipment supply deal with Baker Hughes for A-CAES projects in US, Australia
summary_80w: Long-duration energy storage (LDES) developer-operator Hydrostor has announced a strategic technology and equity agreement with energy infrastructure equipment manufacturer Baker Hughes.

headline: Tesla top, Energy Dome the highest non-lithium firm in new LDES supplier ranking
summary_80w: Lithium-ion companies have come out as the top-rated suppliers on a new long-duration energy storage (LDES) leaderboard, while CO2 Battery company Energy Dome is the highest non-lithium company.

headline: Sungrow PowerTitan 3.0 BESS debuts in Europe, offering 4-8 hour duration
summary_80w: PV inverter and BESS firm Sungrow has launched its PowerTitan 3.0 battery energy storage model for the European market.

headline: European Union battery storage market entered ‘new phase of scale and maturity’ in 2025, but ‘still has a long way to go’
summary_80w: European Union countries deployed record-breaking battery storage capacity for the 12th consecutive year in 2025.

headline: Europe plays ‘critical role’ in renewable energy manufacturing and services
summary_80w: 'Europe plays a critical role in the provision of renewable energy, both in manufacturing and services,' said Low Carbon's Justin Thesiger.

headline: India faces rising solar curtailment as grid struggles to adapt – report
summary_80w: India’s power system faced growing integration challenges in 2025 as solar curtailment emerged as an early signal of insufficient grid flexibility, according to a new report from energy think tank Ember.

headline: GameChange Solar launches distributed generation division

headline: Nextpower begins testing power conversion technology

headline: Maryland commits US$70 million to solar and energy storage financing programme
summary_80w: Maryland has launched a Solar and Energy Storage Gap Financing Program, committing US$70 million to support clean energy projects.

headline: Fraunhofer ISE launches ‘world first’ medium-voltage PV pilot
summary_80w: Fraunhofer ISE is exploring how medium-voltage technology can reduce the use of raw materials such as copper and aluminium in PV systems.

headline: US finds ‘countervailable subsidies’ of 117.4% behind Chinese PV cell imports, plans to impose matching import duties
summary_80w: The US Department of Commerce has found 'countervailable subsidies' of 117.41% provided to China-based manufacturers of solar PV cells.

headline: Financing grid-scale BESS in Europe: successes and challenges in focus as segment becomes industry driver
summary_80w: Leading BESS owner-operators across Europe discuss the key trends around the financing and deployment of grid-scale projects, with the segment now the driver of continent-wide deployments according to trade body SolarPower Europe.

headline: US sodium-ion startup Unigrid begins international shipments of battery cells
summary_80w: US sodium-ion (Na-ion) battery technology company Unigrid has begun international shipments of its proprietary sodium cobalt oxide (NCO) cathode cells at commercial volume.

headline: Pacific Northwest US utility Avista selects 100MW BESS as part of RFP
summary_80w: Utility company Avista has selected projects as part of its request for proposal (RFP) process to identify new resources, including a 100MW battery energy storage system (BESS), for the Pacific Northwest, US.

headline: ERCOT’s battery fleet is the ‘first line of defence for the grid’ through Texas winter storms
summary_80w: ERCOT’s battery storage fleet can play a crucial role during extreme winter conditions, but its own technical performance needs to be carefully managed.

headline: TSOs’ differing understanding of storage is an industry challenge

headline: Trends to look out for at Energy Storage Summit Australia 2026

headline: South Australia battery storage captures 4-hour AU$1,000/MWh price event as heatwave drives revenue uplift
summary_80w: South Australia’s battery storage fleet entered a 4-hour AU$1,000/MWh (US$700/MWh) price event at around 90% state of charge during the Australia Day heatwave.

headline: TSE Energy to build 500MW agrivoltaics portfolio on co-op French farmland
summary_80w: French renewables developer TSE Energy will build a 500MW portfolio of agrivoltaics projects on cooperatively-owned French farmland.

headline: Catalyze secures tax equity financing for 100MW solar projects
summary_80w: Texas-based IPP Catalyze has secured tax equity financing from RBC Community Investments to support its 100MW solar project portfolio across the US.

headline: Enery bags US$297 million to expand European renewables portfolio
summary_80w: Enery has secured over US$297 million to develop its renewable energy portfolio across Czechia, Slovakia, Bulgaria and Slovenia.

headline: Technological breakthroughs and value restructuring: how China’s PV producers are plotting a path to profit recovery in 2026

headline: Pumped hydro, high-temperature thermal storage, and geothermal LDES projects make key advancements across the US

headline: Year in Review: Lunar Energy on the progress of US home energy storage through ‘turbulent 2025’ and the way ahead for virtual power plants
summary_80w: Ed Gunn, VP of revenue at home battery storage and virtual power plant (VPP) specialist Lunar Energy, on the market’s recent past and future potential.

headline: ‘Greater acceptance of merchant exposure’ in UK market, investment firm says

headline: ContourGlobal buys BESS in Greece, Alpiq in France; Iberdrola commissions Spain’s largest projects

summary_80w: Germany’s four transmission system operators (TSOs) have begun procuring inertia services to help stabilise the electric grid as shares of renewable energy grow.

headline: Grid-forming, hybrids and alternative chemistries in Wood Mackenzie’s 2026 energy storage trend predictions
summary_80w: The global energy storage market is poised for continued expansion in 2026, even as supply chain constraints, regulatory evolution, and emerging applications reshape the landscape, according to Wood Mackenzie.

headline: India’s ‘first merchant BESS’: Juniper Green brings 100MWh project into full operation
summary_80w: A subsidiary of Juniper Green Energy has fully brought into commercial operation what the company claimed is India’s first merchant BESS project.

headline: Bridging contracting and factory quality controls in BESS projects

headline: Digital BESS services M&A: Quinbrook sells optimiser Flexitricity, Fortescue’s analytics provider buys Zitara
summary_80w: Fortescue’s battery intelligence platform has acquired analytics provider Zitara, and Drax has agreed to acquire optimiser Flexitricity.

headline: Third utility-scale battery storage project proposed for Western Australia’s Collie

headline: Fortescue claims ‘record-low pricing’ for large-scale battery storage in Australia
summary_80w: Australian mining giant Fortescue has claimed to have secured large-scale battery storage at pricing levels not previously seen in Australia, according to CEO Dino Otranto.

headline: EV slowdown creates potential lifeline for US energy storage amid FEOC, tariffs
